intro: Pluchea crassifolia, commonly known as broadleaf pluchea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, featuring alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a cluster, often accompanied by pale green bracts. Pluchea crassifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields.
